text: Edward Michael Kasko (June 27, 1931 â€“ June 24, 2020) was an American infielder, manager, scout and front office executive. He played for the Major League Baseball.Eddie Kasko, former Red Sox player, manager and executive, dies at 88 Kasko was born in Elizabeth, New Jersey and raised in nearby Linden.Nowlin, Bill. Eddie Kasko, Society for American Baseball Research. Accessed September 4, 2019. "Eddie was born at a hospital in Elizabeth, New Jersey on June 27, 1931, but was raised from birth in Linden, New Jersey, and it was from Linden High School that he graduated in 1949." As a player, he played for the St. Louis Cardinals from 1957 to 1958, Cincinnati Reds from 1959 to 1963, Houston Astros from 1964 to 1965 and the Boston Red Sox in 1966. From 1970 to 1973, he was a manager for the Red Sox. Kasko died on June 24, 2020 in Richmond, Virginia at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Boston Red Sox players Category:Cincinnati Reds players Category:Houston Astros players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Sportspeople from New Jersey Category:Sportspeople from Virginia Category:Businesspeople from New Jersey Category:Businesspeople from Virginia Category:People from Elizabeth, New Jersey
title: Eddie Kasko
